content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> shown in the figure is continuous on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 9, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and differentiable on the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 9, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. Which of the following points satisfies conclusions of both the Intermediate Value Theorem and the Mean Value Theorem for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 9, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
